documentation.text: @notice Address of RARA token contract.
@notice Address of RARA emitter.
@notice Info of each RCM pool.
@notice Sources of each RCM pool.
@notice Shares of the pool measured.

@notice Mapping from tokens to the appropriate Pool PID, for when
 updatess come from listener methods (check the msg sender).
@notice Info of each user that stakes LP tokens.
@dev Total allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all pools.
@dev Total staked allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all pools with nonzero stake.
@notice Rara accumulates, but cannot be harvested before this block

@notice The block at which mining was last "paused". When mining is paused,
 users cannot accumulate Rara, although their mining hashpower may be
 freely updated. Once unpaused, Rara is portioned to them based on
 their _current_ hashpower measured from the pauseBlock; i.e. all hashpower
 updates during a pause are considered as happening atomically during that
 block, regardless of how long the pause actually lasts.
@notice Burn quantity (numerator of a fraction)
@notice Burn quantity (denominator of a fraction)
@notice Burn address (address to receive burned Rara -- 0x0 default)

@param _rara The RaraToken address
 @param _emitter The RaraEmitter address

documentation.text:
@dev Pauses mining. Mining details may be freely changed (both user hashpower
 and pool allocation), with no effect on previously earned Rara. When unpaused,
 proceed as if all changes occurred during {pauseBlock} (i.e. all users receive
 Rara as if those settings had been in effect for the entire pause duration).
 See {Pausable-_unpause}.
 Requirements:
 - the caller must have the `PAUSER_ROLE`.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "RaraCollectibleMining: must have pauser role to unpause"

arguments.value: RaraCollectibleMining: must have pauser role to unpause

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "RaraCollectibleMining: must have pauser role to unpause"

documentation.text:
@dev Unpauses all token transfers.
 See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_unpause}.
 Requirements:
 - the caller must have the `PAUSER_ROLE`.

mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct RaraAnimalMining.UserInfo storage ref))

documentation.text:
@notice Calculates and returns the total Rara mined in the lifetime of
 this contract (including Rara that this contract burned). Outflow is
 determined by the amount received (and owed) from the emitter; if Rara
 is transferred into this contract directly, it is distributed 1-to-1
 with emitted Rara until exhausted.

@notice Update reward variables for all pools. Be careful of gas spending!
 @param pids Pool IDs of all to be updated. Make sure to update all active pools.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct RaraAnimalMining.PoolInfo storage ref[] storage ref

params._token: Address of the ERC-20, ERC-721, or ERC-721Valuable token
params._tokenValued: Whether the token should be treated as ERC-721Valuable with {ownerValue()} used for mining hashpower.
params._votingRegistry: either address 0x00, or an IVotingRegistry used for hashpower multipliers.

params.calls: An array of inputs for each call.
params.revertOnFail: If True then reverts after a failed call and stops doing further calls.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

params.pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.

params.pids: Pool IDs of all to be updated. Make sure to update all active pools.

pause().details: Pauses mining. Mining details may be freely changed (both user hashpower and pool allocation), with no effect on previously earned Rara. When unpaused, proceed as if all changes occurred during {pauseBlock} (i.e. all users receive Rara as if those settings had been in effect for the entire pause duration). See {Pausable-_unpause}. Requirements: - the caller must have the `PAUSER_ROLE`.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params._pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.

returns.pending: Rara reward for a given user.

params._pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.

params._burnAddress: Address of the burner; the indicated Rara proportion will be transferred here (e.g. 0x0).
params._denominator: The share of all Rara out of which {_numerator} is burned. e.g. _numerator = 5, _denominator = 100 will burn 5%.
params._numerator: The share of emitted Rara to burn
params.overwrite: True if the _burnAddress should be set. Otherwise, `_burnAddress` is ignored.

params._block: The block at which to unlock harvesting.

unpause().details: Unpauses all token transfers. See {ERC20Pausable} and {Pausable-_unpause}. Requirements: - the caller must have the `PAUSER_ROLE`.

params._token: Address of the ERC-20, ERC-721, or ERC-721Valuable token
params._tokenValued: Whether the token should be treated as ERC-721Valuable with {ownerValue()} used for mining hashpower.
params._votingRegistry: either address 0x00, or an IVotingRegistry used for hashpower multipliers.

params._pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.

params._burnAddress: Address of the burner; the indicated Rara proportion will be transferred here (e.g. 0x0).
params._denominator: The share of all Rara out of which {_numerator} is burned. e.g. _numerator = 5, _denominator = 100 will burn 5%.
params._numerator: The share of emitted Rara to burn
params.overwrite: True if the _burnAddress should be set. Otherwise, `_burnAddress` is ignored.

params.pid: The index of the pool. See `poolInfo`.

returns.pool: Returns the pool that was updated.

totalAllocPoint.details: Total allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all pools.

totalStakedAllocPoint.details: Total staked allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all pools with nonzero stake.

add(uint256,address,bool,address).notice: Add a new LP to the pool. Performs safety checks and data-integrity operations; this increases in complexity and will become unusable if the total number of pools grows. Switch to batch-execution of {updatePool} and {unsafeAdd} at that point.

batch(bytes[],bool).notice: Allows batched call to self (this contract).

burnAddress().notice: Burn address (address to receive burned Rara -- 0x0 default)

claimFromEmitter().notice: Claim any Rara owed from the emitter, transferring it into this contract. Called by this contract as-needed to fulfill Rara harvests, but can be triggered from outside to square accounts.

harvest(uint256,address).notice: Harvest proceeds for transaction sender to `to`.

massUpdatePools(uint256[]).notice: Update reward variables for all pools. Be careful of gas spending!

pauseBlock().notice: The block at which mining was last "paused". When mining is paused, users cannot accumulate Rara, although their mining hashpower may be freely updated. Once unpaused, Rara is portioned to them based on their _current_ hashpower measured from the pauseBlock; i.e. all hashpower updates during a pause are considered as happening atomically during that block, regardless of how long the pause actually lasts.

pendingReward(uint256,address).notice: View function to see pending Rara on frontend.

permitToken(address,address,address,uint.notice: Call wrapper that performs `ERC20.permit` on `token`. Lookup `IPermitERC20.permit`.

poolLength().notice: Returns the number of RMP pools.

set(uint256,uint256,address,bool,address.notice: Update the given pool's Rara allocation point and `IStakeManager`. Performs safety checks and data-integrity operations; this increases in complexity and will become unusable if the total number of pools grows. Switch to batch-execution of {updatePool} and {unsafeSet} at that point.

setBurnRate(uint256,uint256,address,bool.notice: Safely update the Rara burn rate.

setUnlockBlock(uint256).notice: Set the `unlockBlock`; the block after which mined Rara can be harvested. Can only be called by the manager, and only before the current unlockBlock.

tokenPid(address).notice: Mapping from tokens to the appropriate Pool PID, for when updatess come from listener methods (check the msg sender).

totalReceived().notice: Calculates and returns the total Rara mined in the lifetime of this contract (including Rara that this contract burned). Outflow is determined by the amount received (and owed) from the emitter; if Rara is transferred into this contract directly, it is distributed 1-to-1 with emitted Rara until exhausted.

unlockBlock().notice: Rara accumulates, but cannot be harvested before this block

unsafeAdd(uint256,address,bool,address).notice: Unsafely add a new LP to the pool. Use in a batch after updating active pools. DO NOT add without {claimFromEmitter} and updating active pools. Rewards will be messed up if you do.

unsafeSet(uint256,uint256,address,bool,a.notice: Unsafely update the given pool's Rara allocation point and `IStakeManager`. DO NOT call without {claimFromEmitter} and updating active pools. Rewards will be messed up if you do.

unsafeSetBurnRate(uint256,uint256,addres.notice: Unsafely update the Rara burn rate. DO NOT call this function except as a batch starting with {claimFromEmitter}.

updatePool(uint256).notice: Update reward variables of the given pool.

userInfo(uint256,address).notice: Info of each user that stakes LP tokens.
